info.name: Thalamus, lateral cell mass
info.description: The thalamus (dorsal thalamus) is divided into medial and lateral groups of nuclei by the internal medullary lamina (a thin, curved sheet of myelinated nerve fibers).  The lateral group of nuclei composes the bulk of the thalamus.  It includes the following nuclei:  lateral dorsal, lateral posterior, pulvinar, ventral anterior, ventral lateral, ventral posterior, lateral geniculate, medial geniculate.
info.item: /Sections/Thick, Whole Brain/Coronal/ Frontal to Occipital/7 Cor: Fr to Occ
